titleInfo.title: View No. 3. Missionary Ridge. 4th Louisiana Battalion and 16th and 25th Louisiana Regiment-Infantry.

subject.topic: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)

mods.abstract: The white board marks the position during the battle on the 25th November, 1863, of the center of the 16th and 25th Louisiana, and the board further in the woods the position of the 4th Louisiana Battalion. Both positions are to the left of the positions of the 13th and 20th Louisiana, shown in View No. 2; and on the slope near the crest of the ridge facing Chattanooga and the valley, across which can be seen Lookout Mountain in the distance; the forest growth has arisen since the battle.These positions were fixed September 24th, 1894, by the Louisiana and National Commissioners and marked and noted by E. E. Betts, engineer of the National Commission.

titleInfo.title: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.) Louisiana Committee. Photographs
Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park Photographs

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
